metadata.Description: Mapping and analysis of energy resources and infrastructure in indigenous communities.

indigenous energy mapping.Description: Indigenous energy mapping employs geospatial analysis techniques to identify and map potential energy resources in indigenous territories.
Indigenous energy mapping collaborates with indigenous communities to ensure their knowledge and perspectives are incorporated in energy planning and decision-making processes.
Indigenous energy mapping supports community-led energy projects that aim to provide sustainable and locally-owned energy solutions.
Indigenous energy mapping administers the collection and analysis of energy data to inform decision-making and policy development.
Indigenous energy mapping measures the potential of energy resources in indigenous territories to identify opportunities for sustainable energy development.
Indigenous energy mapping aligns with the principles of indigenous rights, ensuring the protection and respect of indigenous communities' rights in energy planning and development.
Indigenous energy mapping is an instance of community-based energy planning, which involves the active participation and engagement of indigenous communities in energy decision-making processes.
